answers.answer: A web-based interactive computing environment
A programming language
A database management system

question: What are the benefits of using Jupyter Notebook?

answers.answer: It allows for easy data visualization and exploration
It supports multiple programming languages
It can be easily shared with others
It can run on any operating system

question: How do you create a new notebook in Jupyter Notebook?

answers.answer: Click on the "New" button and select "Notebook"
Type "jupyter notebook" in the command line
Download a notebook template from the internet

question: What are the different types of cells in Jupyter Notebook?

answers.answer: Code cells
Markdown cells
Raw cells
Output cells

question: How can you import a dataset into Jupyter Notebook?

answers.answer: Use the pandas library to read in the dataset
Copy and paste the dataset into a code cell
Use the "import" command in Jupyter Notebook

question: What is the purpose of data visualization in data science?

answers.answer: To explore and understand the data
To make the data look pretty
To hide important information in the data

question: How can you add comments to your code in Jupyter Notebook?

answers.answer: Use the "#" symbol before the comment
Use the "//" symbol before the comment
Use the "/* */" symbols to surround the comment

question: How can you share your Jupyter Notebook with others?

answers.answer: Save the notebook as a file and send it to others
Use a cloud-based service like GitHub or Google Drive
Use the "Share" button in Jupyter Notebook to generate a link
Print out the notebook and give it to others
